info.title: OpenAPI Plant Store
info.description: A sample API that uses a plant store as an example to demonstrate features in the OpenAPI specification

post.description:
The primary purpose of this request is to obtain an access token that grants authorization for subsequent API requests. By exchanging valid credentials, such as a username and password, clients can obtain an access token that serves as a bearer token for validating future requests.

Response:
Upon successful authentication, the endpoint responds with an access token and a refresh token. The access token, when included in the Authorization header of subsequent requests, validates the client's authorization. The refresh token allows clients to generate new access tokens without needing to re-enter credentials, enhancing user experience and security.

client_id.description: Required, will be provided by feedspace team.

client_secret.description: Required, will be provided by feedspace team.

get.description:
The primary purpose of this request is to fetch detailed information about the user who is currently logged in and authenticated via OAuth. By accessing this endpoint, clients can retrieve user-specific data, including profile information, preferences, and other relevant details necessary for delivering personalized services.

Response:
Upon successful authentication and authorization, the endpoint responds with a JSON object containing various attributes and details associated with the logged-in user. This may include but is not limited to user ID, username, email address, profile picture URL, and any additional custom attributes.

The primary purpose of this request is to provide users with a paginated list of their workspaces, allowing them to navigate through their projects efficiently. By accessing this endpoint, users can retrieve essential information about each project, such as its name, description, and other relevant details.

Response:
The response contains list of all available workspaces along with associated forms as well. features[] represent text feed forms, audio_features[] represents audio feed forms, video_features[] represents video feed forms.

post.description: The primary purpose of this request is to enable users to create new workspaces tailored to their specific needs and objectives. By submitting the necessary parameters, such as the project name, description, and any other relevant details, users can initiate projects seamlessly.

The primary purpose of this request is to provide users with the capability to update existing workspaces according to their needs. By specifying the workspace ID and providing updated values for relevant attributes, users can effectively modify the properties of the workspace.

get.description: Get paginated list of all Audio Feeds received.
Get details of a specific audio feed based on audio feed ID.

question_answers.question_label: I hereby grant permission to share this review with others.

put.description: Add or remove a specific audio feed to/from favourites.

requestBody.description: Favourite status (1 to add, 0 to remove)

data.transcript: Hi, I'm Prajakha. I'm a content writer, and I've been using feedspace to collect feedback and testimonials from my clients. The feedback is helping me get better at my work and provide better value to my clients. Whereas the testimonials, I've been sharing those on social media. I'm adding them in my portfolio and I am putting them on my blog also along with case studies. This is helping me get a lot of inbound leads and also instill. I trust in my potential clients. So, yeah, it's been really helpful so far.

It is a great feature to collect feedback with just URL.
I am using it for collecting my clients' queries in the video form.
